channel.title: Issue with jarmaker
channel.description:
[s]Well this is sort of odd I have never had this error before. I have done literally hundreds of webclients.
On my XP machine I could jar and sign just fine. On windows seven though it will jar it just fine, but I can't sign it. Needs to be signed to be a webclient.
Whenever I try to sign it it freezes that screen.[/s]
Never mind I think I know where I was messing up now. You see in windows xp I could make the certificate in the java bin folder. But it must not be accessible in win7. So I just made the certificate in my documents and it seemed to fix it;)
sorry for the nooblet post lols.

item.title: Issue with jarmaker
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:8, topic:440034”]create a manifest file
zip it with your compiled source
rename .zip to .jar
???
profit[/quote]
That’s only adding the requirements to start up the application, not put it on the web. Profit-- for you!

Read full topic

item.title: Issue with jarmaker
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:440034”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=542716.msg3977494#msg3977494 date=1334844920]
Never mind I think I know where I was messing up now. You see in windows xp I could make the certificate in the java bin folder. But it must not be accessible in win7. So I just made the certificate in my documents and it seemed to fix it;)

sorry for the nooblet post lols.

topic can be locked thanks guys.
[/quote]
In Windows Vista/7 there are many protected folders that you need administrator privileges to access. Its just a small tool to prevent viruses. Just run JARMaker as admin to solve that :P[/quote]actually it was saying i couldn’t find the jarmaker jar when i did that with a batch file

so I just got it running via my docs babe

Read full topic

item.title: Issue with jarmaker
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:5, topic:440034”]Never mind I think I know where I was messing up now. You see in windows xp I could make the certificate in the java bin folder. But it must not be accessible in win7. So I just made the certificate in my documents and it seemed to fix it;)

sorry for the nooblet post lols.

topic can be locked thanks guys.[/quote]
In Windows Vista/7 there are many protected folders that you need administrator privileges to access. Its just a small tool to prevent viruses. Just run JARMaker as admin to solve that

Read full topic
